Package uk.ac.ed.inf.aqmaps.drone

Class Drone

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.ed.inf.aqmaps.drone.Drone
Direct Known Subclasses:
MainDrone, ShadowDrone
public abstract class Drone
extends java.lang.Object
Our program features two types of drone - this abstract class defines their shared properties, which we would expect each potential other type of drone to incorporate as well.

    protected boolean canMove​(int angle)

  • Constructor Details

    • Drone

      public Drone​(com.mapbox.geojson.Point startingPoint, boolean verbose)
      The constructor of the abstract Drone (super)class. Has behaviour that is needed for Main- as well as ShadowDrones.
      Parameters:
      startingPoint - the starting point of the drone
      verbose - whether we expect printed output from this drone even if no error occurs

  • Method Details

    • makeMove

      protected abstract void makeMove​(int angle)
      This method is the only way in which a drone can move (with the exception of ShadowDrones, which may sometimes be teleported to a different location, when checking whether an obstacle has been avoided).
      Parameters:
      angle - because the length of each move is fixed, the angle is all that defines a move of the drone at its current position

    • makeMoveTowardsGoal

      protected void makeMoveTowardsGoal()
      This method is a short-cut that tells a drone to move straight towards its destination, which should only be done assuming that no obstacle is keeping it from doing so.

    • canMoveTowardsGoal

      protected boolean canMoveTowardsGoal()
      This method determines whether the the drone can take a step towards its current destination without leaving the confinement area or entering any no-fly-zone.
      Returns:
      whether the drone can take a step towards its destination

    • canMove

      protected boolean canMove​(int angle)
      Assuming that the drone is neither started outside the confinement area, nor inside a No-Fly-Zone, the drone is able to move to a point at the appropriate distance if and only if none of the borders of any of these polygons are crossed.
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle that defines the move in question
      Returns:
      whether the specified move is legal

    • park

      public boolean park()
      This method is used when a drone is in move range of its destination, in order to take it all the way there in 1 or 2 steps. The reason being - if a sensor is very close to a building or an edge of the confinement zone, accessing it may be very tricky, because the move distance is greater than the reading range. In this (quite literally) edge case, we will need an "in between move" to enter the radius, because flying straight at the destination will make the drone crash. This is also relevant if we need to make a waiting move because we cannot take two sensor readings on the same step. The idea is simple: Just try all angles! As soon as we find one that lets us enter the required range in two (or preferably only one) steps, that one will do. This is not necessarily efficient, but the movement of our drone is not a bottleneck in the performance of this application anyways.
      Returns:
      whether the parking manoeuvre was successful

    • computeRoundedAngleOfLineToGoal

      protected int computeRoundedAngleOfLineToGoal()
      This helper method constructs a line from the drone's position to its destination, computes its angle and rounds the result to give the "legal" angle that the drone can use that comes closest to the real direction.
      Returns:
      the angle of the line towards the drone's destination, rounded to be a multiple of the angle granularity

    • isInRangeOfDestination

      protected boolean isInRangeOfDestination()
      This method is just a shortcut to find out whether the drone is "close enough" to its current destination.
      Returns:
      whether the distance of drone is no more than the range of the action it plans to do next
